title: Doja Cat debuts new look after shaving her eyebrows on Instagram live
description: Pop singer and rapper Doja Cat debuted an eye-catching new look after shaving her head and eyebrows.

title: Come on, America. Food isn't 'woke'
description: So, Cracker Barrel ... It's a restaurant you traditionally go to after church to eat an unholy amount of biscuits and gravy while your grandma stocks up country-themed tchotchkes and gingham-printed novelty dish towels embroidered with nonsense like "happiness is homemade."

title: How Biden's presidency dramatically changed while he was isolated with Covid
Gigi Hadid teases the launch of her first solo clothing line
description: Gigi Hadid may soon be making the switch from modeling clothes to designing them.

title: The mysterious companies behind Costco's Kirkland Signature and Trader Joe's O's
description: Kirkland Signature. Two-Buck Chuck. Simple Truth. Cat & Jack. Great Value. Amazon Basics. Store brands have never been more popular.

title: Hunters are swarming the Florida Everglades for the annual python challenge. The state says it's vital to save the ecosystem
description: Deer, raccoons, possums, and fox once flocked the area of the Everglades National Park in south Florida.

title: President Joe Biden tests negative for Covid-19 following rebound case
description: President Joe Biden has tested negative for Covid-19 but will remain in isolation pending a second test, his physician announced in a letter Saturday.

title: Los Angeles Dodgers pay tribute to legendary broadcaster Vin Scully
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers paid tribute to Vin Scully on Friday in their first home game since the legendary broadcaster's death.

title: Australian folk star Judith Durham of The Seekers dies at 79
description: Judith Durham, an Australian folk music star and lead singer of The Seekers, has died, according to a statement from her record label. She was 79.

title: How scientists have reanimated cells from dead pigs
description: Since ancient times, the idea of eternal life has captivated the human imagination.

title: Taiwan says multiple Chinese aircraft and vessels spotted in possible simulated attack
description: Taiwan says it detected "multiple" Chinese aircraft and naval vessels taking part in military drills around the Taiwan Strait on Saturday, in what could be a possible simulated attack against the island.

title: How the Ukraine invasion flattened Eastern European tourism
Police shoot and injure four men who they say opened fire at crowded NYC house party
description: New York City Police detectives shot and injured four men they say opened fire at a party in Queens, where around 75 to 100 people were gathered.

title: Get ready to break out in dance with Netflix romantic comedy 'Wedding Season'
description: How is it already August?

title: 'The government should not be involved.' John Legend speaks out on abortion rights
description: Just over a month after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, musician John Legend is advocating for abortion access and reproductive rights.

title: Fears for nuclear safety after shelling at Ukrainian power plant
description: Ukrainian officials and international experts have been warning for months of the risk that fighting poses to a sprawling nuclear power plant on the banks of Dnipro River in southern Ukraine. Earlier this week, the global nuclear watchdog said the situation was becoming increasingly perilous.

title: A record number of women are running in Kenya's elections but many face harassment and abuse
description: Just before sunset, Umra Omar boards a speedboat that will take her around the historic Lamu channel for meetings with voters. As her boat zooms past idyllic islands and arrives at shore 30 minutes later, dozens of women and children rush to greet a candidate they hope will be their next governor.

title: Ukrainians navigate green corridor to Russian-occupied territories
description: CNN's Nic Robertson speaks with Ukrainians navigating the route toward Russian-occupied territory, south of Zaporizhzhia, to reunite with family. Flooding in the region has turned the road to mud.

title: Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson end relationship
description: Kete is no more.

title: The last Salem witch has been exonerated, thanks to an eighth-grade teacher and her students
description: It's never too late to right a historical wrong -- even if that restoration of justice comes nearly 330 years later.

title: Arsenal beats Crystal Palace as the English Premier League returns
description: Arsenal enjoyed a perfect start to the new English Premier League season as it beat Crystal Palace 2-0 at Selhurst Park on Friday.

title: A toddler was killed after a cement truck tumbled over overpass onto a vehicle in Houston
description: A toddler was killed Friday after a cement truck tumbled over an overpass in Houston and landed on top of the car in which he was traveling, officials said.

title: Israeli airstrikes in Gaza kill 11, including senior lslamic Jihad leader
description: The Israeli military launched strikes on targets in Gaza on Friday, a statement from the Israeli army said.

title: Eastern European tourism takes a blow following Ukraine invasion
description:
• Huge relief as Ukrainian grain shipped out, but the food crisis isn't going anywhere
• Lavrov says Russia is ready to discuss prisoner swap with US after Griner conviction

title: Travel news: Space balloons, floating hotels and supersonic jets
description: This week in travel, we look at innovative new transport concepts, the reopening of Thailand's most famous beach, and flight attendants speak out about the airport chaos gripping Europe and America.

title: Why the international climate community isn't popping champagne over the US energy bill
description: The Democrats' $369 billion climate package, the largest such investment in US history, could have significant implications for global greenhouse gas emissions and the US' standing in the world, after months of uncertainty in Congress undermined the Biden administration's claims that "America is back."

title: Lightning strike on oil storage tank in Cuba causes massive fire
description: Lightning struck a large oil storage tank on Friday evening in Matanzas, Cuba, causing a huge fire.

title: US to take part in military exercise near India's disputed border with China
description: The United States is to take part in a joint military exercise with India less than 100 kilometers (62 miles) from the South Asian country's disputed border with China.

title: A sculpture of Vladimir Putin has appeared in a playground in New York City's Central Park
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin showed up in a playground in New York City's Central Park on Monday night.

title: Flash floods kill 550 in Pakistan in heaviest rains in decades
description: Flash floods caused by abnormally heavy monsoon rains killed at least 549 people in Pakistan over the past month, with remote communities in the impoverished southwestern province of Balochistan among the hardest hit, a government agency said.

title: Top Russian hypersonic missile scientist arrested on treason charge
description: A leading Russian scientist in hypersonic flight was arrested on suspicion of treason on Friday, according to Russian state media.

title: 2 dead, 2 injured by lightning strike near White House
description: Two people are dead and two are injured following a lightning strike across the street from the White House Thursday night.
